intro: Sideroxylon capuronii, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic or ovate in shape. It produces small, greenish flowers clustered in spikes, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Sideroxylon capuronii is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils.
